item.title: Astro Bot Scoops Five BAFTA Awards and Dominates The Show
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/bafta-games-awards-astro-bot-scoops/

The BAFTA Games Awards 2025 has wrapped, and all the trophies have been handed out. Sitting at the top of the table is Astro Bot, one of 2024’s most popular titles. It claimed no fewer than five BAFTA Awards, securing the winning spot in some of the most competitive categories, including the prestigious ‘Best Game’ slot.

It was joined by games like Helldivers 2 and Still Wakes the Deep, both of which landed multiple awards during the show.

Astro Bot on Top

Astro Bot has claimed the BAFTA Awards for some iconic categories:

  • Best Game
  • Game Design
  • Family
  • Audio Achievement
  • Animation

The results at the BAFTA Games Awards in London follow months of similar circumstances for Team Asobi’s wonderful platformer.

Still Wakes the Deep also had a nice spree at the BAFTAs, securing the following wins:

  • New IP
  • Performer in a Leading Role
  • Performer in a Supporting Role

Still Wakes the Deep was one of my top games of 2024, boasting some intense horror sequences that unfolded during a tense fight for survival aboard a besieged Scottish oil rig.

Helldivers 2 was able to grab the BAFTA Awards for Music and Multiplayer, while Hellblade II landed Technical Achievement. There’s a special nod reserved for Tales of Kenzera: ZAU, which received the BAFTA Award for Game Beyond Entertainment, which given the game’s backstory, is deserved through and through.

To my surprise, Vampire Survivors won Evolving Game, an award that I thought would for sure go to Hello Games and No Man’s Sky. Balatro managed to secure the award for Debut Game, and Thank Goodness You’re Here, the star-studded and bizarre comedy title, won the award for British Game.]

Stay tuned to Insider Gaming, as I was at the BAFTA Games Awards and secured some exclusive interviews with some of the biggest names in gaming.

item.title: Complete Blue Prince Achievements List
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/complete-blue-prince-achievements-list/

Completing every achievement and unlocking every trophy in Blue Prince, like reaching Room 46, will be difficult, even for grizzled puzzle genre veterans.

Blue Prince is far from the traditional puzzle title. Dogubomb’s debut project puts you in the shoes of an heir to Mount Holly Manor and features tabletop card game and roguelike exploration elements. The simple objective is to explore all 45 rooms of the house and discover a secret 46th room, but there is a twist.

Each door opens to one of three rooms, and the choice is yours. The floor plan resets at the end of each in-game day, changing the house layout. It’s up to you to discover tools and permanent upgrades to solve the mystery behind the disappearance of a children’s book author and more secrets along the way. And If there is one thing puzzle fans also love, it’s trophy hunting in games.

How to Get Every Blue Prince Achievement & Trophy

Every room in Mount Holly Manor features some puzzle, tool, or blueprint to discover. Yet, what makes Blue Prince so unique is that players don’t need to complete every challenge. Every player will experience their own journey based on the map layout. However, this list of achievements applies to everyone and can be completed by following the steps below.

In total, there are eight standard achievements and eight secret achievements. While we have this list of achievements, Dogubomb has remained tight-lipped on what trophies will be available. Yet, completing every achievement above should put you on track to acquire every trophy.
